newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mexico's Zedillo arrives in Japan for state visit.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Zedillo arrives in Japan for state visit.

text.p: Mexican President Ernesto Zedillo arrived in Japan on Monday to begin a four-day state visit which is to include talks with Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto and meetings with Japanese business leaders.

On Wednesday Zedillo and Hashimoto will discuss bilateral relations and issues pertaining to the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum, of which Mexico and Chile are the only Latin American members, Japanese officials said.
Zedillo will also address Japan's Parliament on Wednesday.
The president, accompanied by Foreign Minister Jose Angel Gurria and Finance Minister Guillermo Ortiz, will meet with Japanese business leaders and give a lecture on the Mexican economy.
On Thursday and Friday, Zedillo will visit the central and western Japanese cities of Nagoya, Kyoto and Osaka, where he will meet local officials and attend cultural events.
